title: Radio presenters with disability thrive at 8CCC in Alice Springs | ABC NEWS
description: A local community radio station in Alice Springs has become a breeding ground for new, diverse voices, giving people with a disability a platform to broadcast.   The NDIS provider now hosts a range of programs led by presenters with disability, including an afternoon talk show, a rock program and a segment about anime, and locals love getting on their wavelength. Elsie Lange has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: US review of AUKUS confirms support, bolsters submarine building capability | ABC NEWS
description: The Pentagon has completed its review of the AUKUS nuclear submarine agreement, confirming the United States' commitment to the trilateral defence pact with Australia and the UK. Meanwhile, US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth continues to tread water as pressure rises from twin scandals that threaten to engulf him. title: Private health insurance increasingly failing to provide value, AMA report finds | ABC NEWS
description: A new report from the Australian Medical Association (AMA) reveals that private health insurance is failing to deliver value to the 15 million Australians who hold policies. AMA President Danielle McMullen says that nearly 70 per cent of these policies include exclusions for specific treatments or conditions. The AMA is calling on insurers to invest their profits directly into patient care. title: Chinese nationals arrive by boat in to remote WA Indigenous community | ABC NEWS
description: Six Chinese nationals have been detained by the Australian Border Force after being found in the remote community of Kalumburu, 3,000 kilometres north of Perth.  WA Police Minister Reece Whitby confirmed the men were all Chinese nationals and had arrived by boat. title: Ireland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands boycott Eurovision over Israel's inclusion | ABC NEWS
description: Eurovision heavyweights Ireland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands will boycott 2026's Eurovision after Israel was given the all-clear to compete in the song contest. The countries decided to pull out after the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) said there would not be a vote on whether Israel could participate over its role in the war in Gaza. title: Heatwave stretches from Sydney to Kimberley as hot summer arrives | ABC NEWS
description: A severe heatwave is raising temperatures in the southern states by over 10 degrees above average and increasing the risk of fires to extreme levels. In the northern outback, temperatures are surpassing 40 degrees Celsius. The Bureau of Meteorology warns that this is just the start of one of Australia's hottest summers on record. title: Farm workers vulnerable to exploitation while in visa limbo | ABC NEWS
description: A joint university study from University of New South Wales, the Australian National University and Griffith University has found seasonal farm workers are breaching their visa conditions, due to issues with wages, working conditions, accommodation, and unfair treatment from their PALM scheme employee. An estimated 7,200 PALM workers have left their employers on the scheme and some are left undocumented and without social safety nets. title: Putin bears 'moral responsibility' for Novichok poisoning of UK woman, inquiry finds | ABC NEWS
description: A UK inquiry has found Russian President Vladimir Putin bears 'moral responsibility' for the 2018 poisoning death of a British woman after a failed assassination attempt against a former Russian double agent. Former Russian agent Sergei Skripal was targeted with the military-grade nerve agent by GRU military intelligence officers but mother-of-three Dawn Sturgess was an unintended fatality in the operation. title: Lingering overnight heat prompts warning from NSW Ambulance | ABC NEWS
description: NSW Ambulance is warning of a severe heatwave across the state, particularly in metropolitan Sydney, the Hunter, the South Coast and Illawarra regions, due to overnight temperatures in the mid to high 20s. People are being told to keep hydrated, wear loose fitting clothing and stay inside with a fan or air conditioner. title: Two-dose shingles vaccine slows dementia progression, study shows | ABC NEWS
description: The shingles vaccine not only protects against the painful viral infection but may also slow the progression of dementia, according to a new study. Conducted by Stanford University researchers, the study examined health records of over 300,000 individuals from Wales and Australia. Senior author Pascal Geldsetzer noted that the vaccine's protective effects can even be observed in those with dementia who become eligible for vaccination. title: Probe into death of Greg Lynn's first wife stalls over cost of expert report, family says | ABC News
description: A fresh investigation into the death of convicted murderer Greg Lynn's first wife has stalled over a $9,000 bill for an expert report, her family says.  Detectives had hoped the expert report would shed light on whether the scene of Lisa Lynn's death in 1999 could have been staged. An initial police investigation failed to uncover any suspicious circumstances.  By Elise Kinsella for ABC News Victoria  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://shorturl.at/euCGt  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Dolphin Sands bushfire footage shows conditions firefighters are dealing with | ABC NEWS
description: Grass and bushfires are burning across the country, with firefighters in Tasmania trying to get this emergency-level fire near Dolphin Sands, north east of Hobart, under control on Thursday.   The Tasmania Fire Service say it's optimistic fire fighting efforts will be successful today, as changing conditions bring cooler temperatures and lighter winds. title: Latest search for Dezi Freeman now focused on finding his body | ABC NEWS
description: Victoria Police says a targeted search has focused on locating evidence or the body of fugitive Dezi Freeman, four months after he allegedly fatally shot two police officers in Porepunkah, in north-east Victoria. In a statement, a police spokesperson said an extensive targeted search of the Mount Buffalo National Park had been carried out in the past week as part of its ongoing investigation.
